各位大英帝國做緊嘢／將會做嘢嘅巴絲打，歡迎入嚟呢到鳩噏扮下工

Q&A credit to 滑蛋豬仔飯

Q: 如果無BC又想係英國打工係咪好難?

A:
通常會比working visa一係大公司
D細公司仔都見過有批不過當然會少D

老老實實渣BNO/特區係就係難D不過都唔係無可能
都識得有人搞得掂個visa
以前有同學會係cv度寫明話要working visa
如果間公司都肯in你既話多數即係肯批
唔洗浪費大家時間
大小公司都有 試下無妨

再唔係學其他巴打講
申請左working holiday做住先都未嘗不可
當然之後整唔整到tier 2 working visa就唔敢講
不過起碼都有2年比你係度做下野儲下經驗先

如果做開比較專業行業既朋友其實拎左working holiday visa先，再轉tier 2既機會都幾樂觀，都識幾個朋友都係咁，好似都係做design / I.T.之類 (by 賽麗娜Serena)


Q: 想問下英國見工係咪同香港一樣都係上網報?

A:
如果你話搵工過程其實同香港差唔多
睇你咩工啦
普通黎講大公司既話都係cv cover letter -> online test -> phone in-> assessment centre ( 可以好多round) -> final in
細公司就少幾個步驟咁


Q: 想問下係咪bno 同特區都可以fg 一年tier5 先，唔洗特登要搵肯比tier2 既公司住

A:
你英國畢業定香港想過去？ 唔係英國畢業唔肯定當地申請有無唔同但BNO 隨時可以申請tier 5 重有兩年，特區要抽架，都係兩年。
當地申請可能短d , 我當初因爲公司未令到可以簽visa 既licence 就幫我申請住tier 5 先，得特區又過左抽籤所以係visa 公司幫我係英國申請，但咁就得一年.. 無深究點解。
但全部香港申請過去既都有兩年。 (by 花生哥)

A: 唔遲
雖然有啲係截左
但仲有好多
留學生有優勢 就係唔怕relocation
成個英國既工你都apply得
宜家真係開始send cv都唔會太遲既
好多大公司如果唔係grad scheme既話其實一路都請緊人
以前好多同學都係8/9月先有offer
有D直頭下年1月先有工開
所以唔洗擔心既肯踏出第一步搵工就ok (by 馬壯FN2)

Q1: 咩方法先黎到英國做野?
A1:
Case 1
Tier 2 (General) visa

You can apply for a Tier 2 (General) visa if:
you’ve been offered a skilled job in the UK

You need to be employed by a licensed sponsor to apply to live in the UK.

Tier2 有3/5年期之分

https://www.gov.uk/tier-2-general

Case 2
Tier 5 (Youth Mobility Scheme) visa - Also known as working holiday

You can apply for a Tier 5 (Youth Mobility Scheme) visa if you:

want to live and work in the UK for up to 2 years
are aged 18 to 30
have £1,890 in savings
have certain types of British Nationality or are from certain countries (including BNO)

Note: You need to be sponsored if you’re from Hong Kong or the Republic of Korea.


https://www.gov.uk/tier-5-youth-mobility

You cannot apply for either of the above Visa in UK.

BNO 參軍

唔多記得...

Q2: 想係英國定居, 應該點做?
A2:
娶/嫁 鬼妹/佬, 投資一百萬英鎊

Settle in the UK: long residence
Case 1
住夠十年, 讀書, Tier 5, Tier 2 全部都計
https://www.gov.uk/long-residence

Case 2
Tier 2 係英國番夠五年工
You can apply if:

you have a Tier 2 (General) visa
you’ve been living and working in the UK for 5 years and spent no more than 180 days outside the UK in any 12 months (‘continuous residence’)
your employer (sponsor) still needs you for your job - they’ll need to provide a document confirming this
your job pays £35,500 or more (unless you’re exempt from the ‘minimum earnings threshold’)
you get paid the relevant salary listed in the Codes of Practice


https://www.gov.uk/settle-in-the-uk/y/you-have-a-work-visa/tier-2-general-visa

Visa
Option 1

Tier 5 (Youth Mobility Scheme) visa - Also known as working holiday
https://www.gov.uk/tier-5-youth-mobility

You can apply for a Tier 5 (Youth Mobility Scheme) visa if you:

want to live and work in the UK for up to 2 years
are aged 18 to 30
have £1,890 in savings (only the moment when you apply)

Don't worry about these if you are using BNO
Note: If you’re applying this visa using HKSAR passport
You need to be sponsored
There will be an annual quota

Option 2
Tier 2 (General) visa
https://www.gov.uk/tier-2-general

this shit is such a long and painful process, especially if your employer is not familiar to this visa

You can apply for a Tier 2 (General) visa if:
you’ve been offered a skilled job in the UK

You need to be employed by a licensed sponsor to apply to live in the UK.

replies.msg:
The first step to UK is to read through all the information provided (google it yourself if necessary)
as some British might not even know how to do their job (HR are all the same around the globe)

Visa

Tier 5 (Youth Mobility Scheme) visa - Also known as working holiday
https://www.gov.uk/tier-5-youth-mobility

Don't worry about below if you are using BNO
Note: If you’re applying this visa using HKSAR passport
You need to be sponsored
There will be an annual quota

Tier 2 (General) visa
https://www.gov.uk/tier-2-general

this shit is such a long and painful process, especially if your employer is not familiar to this visa

You can apply for a Tier 2 (General) visa if:
you’ve been OFFERED a skilled job in the UK

Apply to settle

If you truly love your life in UK
you might apply to settle

Option 1

If you have been living in UK for 10 years
and met certain requirements
https://www.gov.uk/long-residence/eligibility

Option 2
If you have been living and working (under Tier 2) in the UK for 5 years
and met certain requirements
https://www.gov.uk/settle-in-the-uk/y/you-have-a-work-visa/tier-2-general-visa

貼番上黎
